casebody.data:
In the Matter of: MEGA-C POWER CORPORATION, a Nevada corporation, a/k/a Net Capital Adventures, Inc., Debtor, Lewis “Chip” Taylor; Jared Taylor; Colin Taylor; Chip Taylor In Trust; Elgin Investments, Inc., “The Taylor Group”, Appellants, v. Mega-C Power Corporation, a Nevada corporation; United States Trustee; William M. Noall Chapter 11 Trustee; Axion Power Corporation; Sally Fonner Axion Power International, Inc., Appellees. No. 06-17403. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. Oct. 2, 2008. Michael Lehners, Esquire, Reno, NV, Fred A. Platt, Esquire, Canada, Gregory L. Wilde, Esquire, Graham & Wilde, P.C., Las Vegas, NV, for Appellants. Louis T. Delucia, Esquire, Buchanan Ingersoll & Rooney PC, New York, NY, James D. Greene, Esquire, Brownstein Hyatt Farber Schreck LLP, Las Vegas, NV, Stephen R. Harris, Esquire, Belding Harris & Petroni, Ltd., U.S. Trustee, Esquire, U.S. Bankruptcy Trustee, Alan R. Smith, Esquire, Law Offices of Alan R. Smith, Cecilia L. Rosenauer, Esquire, Reno, NV, Gerald M. Gordon, Gordon & Silver, Las Vegas, NV, for Appellees.

Before: O’SCANNLAIN and SILVERMAN, Circuit Judges, and SINGLETON,* Senior District Judge.

The Honorable James K. Singleton, United States District Judge for the District of Alaska, sitting by designation.

ORDER

In light of the parties’ September 24, 2008, Stipulation to Dismiss Appeal No. 06-17403, this case is resubmitted. Pursuant to Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 42(b), this case is

DISMISSED. The mandate shall issue forthwith.
